Replies.Reply: The Glengarry Highland's leads, you're sending Roma out.  Fine.
No.  John.  No.  Let's wait, let's back up here, I did...will you please?  Wait a second.  Please.  I didn't "blow" them.  No.  I didn't "blow" them.  No.  One kicked out, one I closed...
...you want to see the court records?  John?  Eh?  You want to go down...
What is this "you say"?  A deal kicks out...I got to eat.  Shit, Williamson, shit.  You...Moss...
Lately kiss my ass lately.  That isn't how you build an org...talk, talk to Murray.  Talk to Mitch.
Bullshit the thirtieth, I don't get on the board the thirtieth, they're going to can my ass.  I need the leads.  I need them now.  Or I'm gone, and you're going to miss me, John, I swear to you.
Marshal the leads...marshal the leads?  What the fuck, what bus did you get off of, we're here to fucking sell.  Fuck marshaling the leads.  What the fuck talk is that?
I am.  I'm sorry to antagonize you.
...and I'm going to get bounced and you're...

The premium leads.  Yes.  I know what they cost.  John.  Because I, I generated the dollar revenue sufficient to buy them.  Nineteen senny-nine, you know what I made?
Fuck him.  Fuck Murray.  John?  You know?  You tell him I said so.
Money.  A fortune.  Money lying on the ground.  Murray?  When was the last time he went out on a sit?
That's fucked.  That's fucked.  You don't look at the fucking percentage.
I'll tell you why I'm out.  I'm out, you're giving me toilet paper.
I've seen those leads.  I saw them when I was at Homestead, we pitched those cocksuckers Rio Rancho nineteen sixty-nine they wouldn't buy.  They couldn't buy a fucking toaster.  They're broke, John.
They all kick out.  You run in streaks, pal.  Streaks.  I'm...
Bullshit, bullshit, you assign them... What are you telling me?
Then put me on the board.
I can't close these leads, John.
And what if you don't close.
I will close.  John, John, ten percent.  I can get hot.  You know that...
Fuck that.  That's defeatist.  Fuck that.  Fuck it...Get on my side.
Listen.  I want to talk to you.
No.  You're right.  That's for later.  We'll talk in a month.
I saw the board.  You've got four...
Bullshit.  They ain't been in the office yet.  Give 'em some stiff.
I'm coming in here with the sales, I'll pay you tomorrow.
I haven't got it, when I pay, the gas...I get back the hotel, I'll bring it in tomorrow.
I'll give you thirty on them now, I'll bring the rest tomorrow.  I've got it at the hotel.
I'm asking you.  As a favor to me?
Well, I want to tell you something, fella, wasn't long I could pick up the phone, call Murray and I'd have your job.  You know that?  Not too long ago.  For what?  For nothing.
The one.  Give me the lead.  Give me the one lead.  The best one you have.
Is that it?  Is that it?  You want to do business that way...?
You want to do business that way...?
I'd like something off the other list.  Which, very least, that I'm entitled to.  If I'm still working here, which for the moment I guess that I am.
What?  I'm sorry I spoke harshly to you.
The deal still stands, our other thing.
Good.  Mmm.  I, you know, I left my wallet back at the hotel.

Get the chalk.  Get the chalk...get the chalk!  I closed 'em!  I closed the cocksucker.  Get the chalk and put me on the board.  I'm going to Hawaii!  Put me on the Cadillac board, Williamson!  Pick up the fuckin' chalk.  Eight units.
You bet your ass.  Who wants to go to lunch?  Who wants to go to lunch?
Read it.  Bruce and Harriett Nyborg.
Hey, big fucking deal.  Broke a bad streak...
Williamson, get on the phone, call Mitch...
"...You look around, you say, 'This one has so-and-so, and I have nothing..."
"'Why?  Why don't I get the opportunities...?"
"I want to tell you something, Harriet..."
Will you shut up, I'm telling you this...
"You do get the opportunity...You get them.  As I do, as anyone does..."
I got 'em in the kitchen.  I'm eating her crumb cake.
Rick.  Let me tell you.  Wait, we're in the...
"What we have to do is admit to ourself that we see that opportunity...and take it.
And that's it." And we sit there.
That's what I'm saying.  The old ways.  The old ways...convert the motherfucker...sell him...sell him... make him sign the check.
The...Bruce, Harriet...the kitchen, blah: they got their money in government bonds...I say fuck it, we're going to go the whole route.

Bruce..."I don't want to fuck around with you.  I don't want to go round this, and pussyfoot around the thing, you have to look back on this.  I do, too.  I came here to do good for you and me.  For both of us.  Why take an interim position?

The only arrangement I'll accept is full investment.  Period.  The whole eight units.  I know that you're saying 'be safe,' I know what you're saying.  I know if I left you to yourselves, you'd say 'come back tomorrow,' and when I walked out that door, you'd make a cup of coffee...you'd sit down...and you'd think 'let's be safe...' and not to disappoint me you'd go one unit or maybe two, because you'd become scared because you'd met possibility.  But this won't do, and that's not the subject..."
Bullshit, you're...No.  That's raw... well, if I did, then I'm glad I did.  I, well.  I locked on them.  All on them, nothing on me.
They, I swear to God, they both kind of imperceptibly slumped.  And he reaches and takes the pen and signs, he passes it to her, she signs.  It was so fucking solemn.
It's better than a good sale.  It's a...
All that I'm telling you: that one thing you can tell them it's a remarkable sale.
Why should the sale not stick?
Would you?  Would you...?  Or you're gonna what, fire me?

What I'm saying to you: things can change.  You see?  This is where you fuck up, because this is something you don't know.  You can't look down the road.  And see what's coming.  Might be someone else, John.  It might be someone new, eh?  Someone new.  And you can't look back. 'Cause you don't know history.  You ask them.  When we were at Rio Rancho, who was top man?  A month...?  Two months...?

...and you don't remember. 'Cause you weren't around.  That's cold calling.  Walk up to the door.  I don't even know their name.  I'm selling something they don't even want.  You talk about soft sell...

Well, it isn't coming out until the February iss...sure.  Sure, go ahead, Ricky.

Oh, my God, you're right!  I'm on the one...

Rick, I'm going to flag a cab.

...excuse me, nothing, you be as cold as you want, but you just fucked a good man out of six thousand dollars and his goddamn bonus 'cause you didn't know the shot, if you can do that and you aren't man enough that it gets you, then I don't know what, if you can't take some thing from that...
Don't fuck with me, John, don't fuck with me...what are you saying?
Sure!  I robbed the office.  Sure.

That if the sale sticks, it will be a miracle.

How do you know I made it up?

How did you know that I made it up?
I told the customer that his contracts had gone to the bank.

What'd you do with the leads?
You want to go in there?  I tell him what I know, he's going to dig up something...You got an alibi last night?  You better have one.

If you tell me where the leads are, I won't turn you in.  If you don't, I am going to tell the cop you stole them, Mitch and Murray will see that you go to jail.  Believe me they will.  Now, what did you do with the leads?  I'm walking in that door--you have five seconds to tell me: or you are going to jail.
How much did you get for them?
How much did you get for them?
I want to tell you something, Shelly.  You have a big mouth.
You've got a big mouth, and now I'm going to show you an even bigger one.
No, I don't think so, Shel.
No, I think I don't want your money.

You missed a fucking sale.  Big deal.  A deadbeat Polack.  Big deal.

You get those names come up, you ever get 'em, "Patel?"
You had one you'd know it.  Patel.

The whole fuckin' thing...The pressure's just too great.  You're ab...you're absolu...they're too important.  All of them.  You go in the door.  I..."I got to close this fucker, or I don't eat lunch," "or I don't win the Cadillac..." We fuckin' work too hard.  You work too hard.  We all, I remember when we were at Platt...huh?  Glen Ross Farms... didn't we sell a bunch of that..."
We're stuck with this fucking shit...
You get a bad month, all of a...
All of, they got you on this "board..."
I know it's not.  I'll tell you, you got, you know, you got...what did I learn as a kid on Western?
Goddamn right, that's right.  Guys come on: "Oh, the blah blah blah, I know what I'll do: I'll go in and rob everyone blind and go to Argentina cause nobody ever thought of this before."
And so they kill the goose.  I, I, I'll...and a fuckin' man, worked all his life has got to...
For some fuckin' "Sell ten thousand and you win the steak knives..."
...sales promotion, "You lose, then we fire your..." No.  It's medieval... it's wrong. "Or we're going to fire your ass." It's wrong.
Yes, it is.  And you know who's responsible?
You know who it is.  It's Mitch.

Look at Jerry Graff.  He's clean, he's doing business for himself, he's got his, that list of his with the nurses...see?  You see?  That's thinking.  Why take ten percent?  A ten percent comm...why are we giving the rest away?  What are we giving ninety per...for nothing.
That's thinking.  Now, he's got the leads, he goes in business for himself.  He's...that's what I...
So Graff buys a fucking list of nurses, one grand--if he paid two I'll eat my hat--four, five thousand nurses, and he's going wild...
You hear a lot of things...He's doing very well.  He's doing very well.
River Oaks, Brook Farms.  All of that shit.  Somebody told me, you know what he's clearing himself?
That's what I'm saying.  Why?  The leads.  He's got the good leads...
What do you need? A telephone, some broad to say "Good morning,"
Yes.  It is.  It is simple, and you know what the hard part is?
Of doing the thing.  The dif...the difference.  Between me and Jerry Graff.  Going to business for yourself.  The hard part is...you know what it is?
To say "I'm going on my own."
He made up those rules, and we're working for him.
That's the God's truth.  And it gets me depressed.  I swear that it does.  At MY AGE.  To see a goddamn: "Somebody wins the Cadillac this month.  P.S. Two guys get fucked."
You don't ax your sales force.
You fucking build it!  Men come...
Look look look look, when they build your business, then you can't fucking turn around, enslave them, treat them like children, fuck them up the ass, leave them to fend for themselves... no.
You're absolutely right, and I want to tell you something.
I want to tell you what somebody should do.
Someone should stand up and strike back.
How?  Do something to hurt them.
That's what I'm saying.  We were, if we were that kind of guys, to knock it off, and trash the joint, it looks like robbery, and take the fuckin' leads out of the files...go to Jerry Graff.
What could we get for them?  I don't know.  Buck a throw...buck-a-
Graff?  Because I worked for him.
No.  What do you mean?  Have I talked to him about this?
I said, "Not actually." The fuck you care, George?  We're just talking...
That's right.  It's a crime.  It is a crime.  It's also very safe.
What did he say?  He'd buy them.
However they are, that's the deal.
Twenty-five hundred apiece.  One night's work, and the job with Graff.  Working the premium leads.
He would take you on.  Yes.
It's a big reward.  For one night's work.
But it's got to be tonight.
That's right, the guys are moving them downtown.  After the thirtieth.
You have to get the leads.
It's not something for nothing, George, I took you in on this, you have to go.  That's your thing.

What will they know?  That I stole the leads?  I didn't steal the leads, I'm going to the movies tonight with a friend, and then I'm going to the Como Inn.  Why did I go to Graff?  I got a better deal.
Listen to this.  I have an alibi, I'm going to the Como Inn, why?
They come to you, you going to turn me in?
They're going to come to everyone.
You wouldn't, George, that's why I'm talking to you.  Answer me.

Then listen to this: I have to get those leads tonight.  That's something I have to do.  If I'm not at the movies...if I'm not eating over at the inn...If you don't do this, then I have to come in here...
...they take me, then.  They're going to ask me who were my accomplices.
Well, to the law, you're an accessory.  Before the fact.
Then tough luck, George, because you are.
That's none of your fucking business...
Why?  Why you going to give me five grand?
Is that what I just said?
Hey, hey, let's just keep it simple, what I need is not the...what do you need...?
Alright?  My end is my business.
Cop couldn't find his dick two hands and a map.  Anyone talks to this guy's an asshole...

Hey, I don't want to hear your fucking war stories...
Give me some leads.  I'm going out... I'm getting out of...
Na, fuck the leads, I'm going home.
Hey, they're fuckin' garbage any case...This whole goddamn...

...the fuck is that supposed to mean...?
Fuck is that supposed to mean?
Ricky?...That I don't care they stole the contracts?

Ricky.  You have a mean streak in you...
And what the fuck are you babbling about...?
Bring that shit up.  Of my volume.

Sittin' on top of the world, sittin' on top of the world, everything's fucking peachfuzz...

I'm not going home.  I'm going to Wisconsin.

Where am I going to work?
I'd never try to sell an Indian.
Well, I think I had one once.
They came in and they, you know...

I heard that they were running cold.
The leads, the overhead, the telephones, there's lots of things.
No, it's not that simple, Dave...
What could somebody get for them?
How many leads have we got?
And you're saying a fella could take and sell these leads to Jerry Graff.
How do you know he'd buy them?
Yes.  I mean are you actually talking about this, or are we just...
We're not actually talking about it.
So all this, um, you didn't, actually, you didn't go talk to Graff.
Because, because, you know, it's a crime.
You're going to steal the leads?
You're going to steal the leads and sell the leads to him?

You're, you're saying so you have to go in there tonight and...

Why would they come to me?
...I thought that we were only talking...

Why are you doing this to me, Dave.

What is the, you said that we were going to split five...

I, um, and may...maybe they're in...
I, you know, they should be insured.
Then, you know, they wouldn't be so ups...

I'm, I'm, I'm, I'm fucked on the board.  You.  You see how...I...

Where criminals can come in here...
You think they're going to catch...
'Cause, you know, 'cause they weren't, I know that Mitch and Murray uh...
That they're going to be upset.
He said we're all going to have to go talk to the guy.
When I talk to the police, I get nervous.
But what should I tell them?
Fuck.  I had them on River Glen.
If anyone's going, I could use some coffee.
I'm through, with this fucking meshugaas.  No one should talk to a man that way.  How are you talking to me that...?
...how can you talk to me that...
I didn't...why should I..."Where were you last..." Is anybody listening to me...?  Where's Moss...?  Where...?
...Come in here...I work here, I don't come in here to be mistreated...
I want to work today, that's why I came...
...that's why I came in.  I thought I...
I don't want to go to lunch.

That's why I came in...I meet gestapo tac...
I meet gestapo tactics...I meet gestapo tactics...That's not right... No man has the right to..."Call an attorney," that means you're guilt... you're under sus..."Co...," he says, "cooperate"

Did the leads come in yet?
Oh, God, I hate this job.
...all train compartments smell vaguely of shit.  It gets so you don't mind it.  That's the worst thing that I can confess.  You know how long it took me to get there?
Or a piss...?  A great meal fades in reflection.  Everything else gains.  You know why? 'Cause it's only food.  This shit we eat, it keeps us going.  But it's only food.

If that's what it signifies to you.

I'm going out and reclose last week's...
Okay, okay, okay, gimme this shit.

And so you haven't got a contract to get stolen or so forth.
